text: Hey there! 👋 I'm here to share some interesting insights on the impact of the energy crisis on equity valuations, specifically in Europe. 💡💰 Did you know that firms with high energy exposure have seen a negative effect on their equity returns? 🤔 That's right! 📉 A one standard deviation increase in energy exposure is associated with a 0.9 percentage point reduction in European firms' returns. 💸But, what's the reason behind this? 🤔 Well, it's all about the heavy dependence on energy imports from Russia. ���RC With the recent developments in Ukraine, the energy market has been shook up, and Europe has felt the reverberations. 🌎So, how can we measure this impact? 🤔 We can use data from Refinitiv to compare the TTF natural gas price (Europe's benchmark) and the Henry Hub natural gas price (US benchmark, converted in Euro/MWh). 📊And, what do we find? 🤔 A negative effect on equity returns in Europe! 💸 Check out this time-varying evidence in Figure 2. 📈In conclusion, the energy crisis has had a significant impact on equity valuations in Europe, particularly for firms with high energy exposure. 🌟 So, it's essential to keep an eye on these trends and make informed investment decisions. 💡That's all for now! 👋 Thanks for tuning in, and don't forget to follow me for more exciting insights on economics and finance! 😊
